episodes.rawTitle: veckan dom mot tjej med knarklagret och hd som kan forandr allt
episodes.title: VECKAN: Domen mot tjejerna med knarklagret och HD-domen som kan förändra allt
episodes.description:
Långa fängelsestraff efter att polisen hittade mer än 400 kilo knark i en lägenhet i Sollentuna. En man döms till livstids fängelse efter att Högsta domstolen prövat ett indiciemål.
Vi har tidigare berättat om den 18-åriga tjej som polisen hittade sovandes i ett lägenhetshotell i Sollentuna bland sopsäckar med narkotika. Nu döms hon till sju års fängelse för synnerligen grovt narkotikabrott. I tingsrätten berättade hon sin version av det som hänt. "Hon har hamnat i en situation där hon har dragit på sig en skuld och då fått detta som ett alternativ. Att hon ska förvara viss narkotika i form av hasch och en liten mängd under en kortare period", berättar hennes advokat Ersin Aziman.När hon märkte att det var mer narkotika än hon trott så ska hon ha försökt dra sig ur, men då blivit hotad. Den förklaringen köper dock inte tingsrätten. Även den andra, tidigare ostraffade, kvinnan döms till sju år och sex månaders fängelse.Högsta domstolens dom om ett mord i Märsta 2020 har nu kommit. Den man som tidigare friats av hovrätten döms nu till livstids fängelse. Och den här domen kan få stor betydelse i framtiden eftersom det bygger på så kallad indiciebevisning.

episodes.title: Melanie Flynn & Cocaine Bear Pt One
episodes.description:
January 25, 1977. Lexington, Kentucky. 24-year old Melanie Flynn leaves her workplace, but fails to show up for an appointment and does not return home for dinner with her family. Two weeks later, Melanie’s abandoned car is discovered in an apartment complex parking lot and her purse is found washed up next to the Kentucky River later that summer. After numerous eyewitnesses claim to have seen Melanie alive in Florida, the police close the investigation, but her family is convinced she was murdered. Over the years, rumours circulate that Melanie worked as an undercover informant for the narcotics squad and was killed by corrupt police officers who were involved in drug trafficking. The story eventually balloons into a mammoth scandal known as the “Bluegrass Conspiracy”, but no trace of Melanie is ever found. This week’s episode of “The Path Went Chilly” explores a convoluted missing persons case which may have been connected to a multi-million-dollar drug smuggling ring & the side story of the tie in case of Cocaine Bear.
Patreon.com/julesandashley
Patreon.com/thetrailwentcold
Additional Reading:http://charleyproject.org/case/melanie-dee-flynn“The Bluegrass Conspiracy: An Inside Story of Power, Greed, Drugs and Murder” by Sally Dentonhttps://www.kentucky.com/news/local/crime/article232423297.htmlhttps://www.newspapers.com/image/101002756/https://www.newspapers.com/image/110786699/https://www.newspapers.com/image/110800054/

episodes.rawTitle: death kate morgan hotel del coronado
episodes.title: The Death of Kate Morgan at the Hotel Del Coronado
episodes.description:
In 1892 an woman going by the name Lottie Bernard checked in to the Hotel del Coronado in Coronado, CA. Within a few days she would be deceased and everything she told the hotel, including her identity, would be thrown into question. Who is the woman who checked in and why did she die? These questions would eventually be answered...or would they? And is it possible there's a ghostly connection? Plus history of the illustrious Hotel del Coronado,
If you would like to support us we have a Patreon page at: https://www.patreon.com/californiatruecrime

episodes.title: Jett Miller's Version Under Oath
episodes.description:
Telling the truth under oath is important because it is a legal and ethical obligation that carries serious consequences for violating it. When a person is under oath, they swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth. This oath in front of a legal authority is a solemn promise to tell the truth in a legal proceeding.

The importance of telling the truth under oath lies in the fact that the legal system relies on the testimony of witnesses to establish facts and make informed decisions. The judicial process can be undermined if witnesses do not tell the truth.

Telling the truth under oath is essential for upholding the integrity of the legal system and ensuring that justice is served fairly and impartially.

In this episode, you will hear Jett Miller under oath in his deposition giving his version of the night before Christian died, otherwise known as “gun night.” Jett Miller will tell the attorneys his version of how the evening came about, where they were, and who was there. He also claims he never met Whitley Goodman before Christian’s death.

For a refresher Season 2 of Without Warning Podcast covers the Christian Andreacchio story.

PI Page: www.sheilawysocki.com

episodes.title: New Series: Operation Morning Light
episodes.description:
On a January night in 1978, a white light burned through the sub-Arctic sky. It was Cosmos 954, a nuclear-powered Soviet espionage satellite that had malfunctioned and fallen to earth. As the satellite disintegrated, it scattered dangerously radioactive debris across the vast traditional lands of the Dene, Métis, and Inuit in the Northwest Territories of Canada. Operation Morning Light tells the story of the Cosmos 954 disaster, its impact on the land, and the resilience of the communities in the debris field.

'Best Podcasts of 2022' - Financial Times

Listen now: http://link.chtbl.com/operation

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

episodes.title: Mr. Stinky Feet Finds a Killer
episodes.description:
Retired intelligence detective Gary Jenkins interviews Jim Cosgrove, aka Mr. Stinky Feet, a Kansas City children’s entertainer and author. Mr. Cosgrove reports on a multi-year investigation he conducted and chronicled in his book Ripple: A Long Strange Search for a Killer. This investigation takes him into the Low Country of South Carolina, where he finds the local crime boss and his underlings may have been the killers.

episodes.title: [2000] Rozbicie mafii pruszkowskiej | Operacja "Enigma" | KRONIKI POLSKIEJ MAFII
episodes.description:
Gdy czerwcu 2000 roku Jarosław Sokołowski ps. Masa oficjalnie przystał do programu ochrony świadków, na wciąż swobodnie działające grupy przestępcze padł blady strach. Śledczy skrupulatnie notowali każde wymienione przez niego nazwisko, pseudonim czy opisane przestępstwo. Po kilku miesiącach zbierania informacji władze uznały, że są gotowe do uderzenia w największy gang w Polsce. Tak rozpoczęła się największa ofensywa polskiej policji, która otrzymała kryptonim "Enigma".

episodes.title: NEW: Alec Baldwin "Rust" Affidavit
episodes.description:
"Mind Over Murder" podcast hosts Bill Thomas and Kristin Dilley discuss the probable cause affidavits filed against producer and star Alec Baldwin and head armorer Hannah Gutierrez Reed in the 2021 accidental shooting death of cinematographer Halnya Hutchins on the set of "Rust," a western movie being shot in New Mexico. After a civil suit with Hutchins' husband was settled, will Baldwin and Reed found to be criminally liable for her accidental death?

series.title: True Crime Today  | A True Crime Podcast

network.name: True Crime Today  | A True Crime Podcast

episodes.title: Getting In and Getting Out
episodes.description:
Chicago gangs: Real people. Real stories. A way forward. The new season of Motive explores violence on the streets of Chicago and the former gang members working to stop it.

In 2021, 7-year-old Jaslyn Adams was killed by bullets meant for her father. The killing shook Chicago, and affected many of the anti-violence workers on the West Side. It showed the dangers some children face everyday in the city.

In this episode, Jaslyn’s dad, Jontae, explains how he got into a gang and how his fellow gang members turned on him when he decided to help police instead of exacting street justice.

The path leading to his daughter’s death started when Jontae was just 11 years old. Anti-violence worker “Fatz” joined a gang when he was just a kid too. So did victim advocate Ceci. Their stories are all remarkably similar.

Now, Ceci and her coworkers are trying to keep another young man from the same fate.

About the host

Patrick Smith is a criminal justice reporter at WBEZ. He has been reporting on Chicago violence, police and the people at the center of it all for nearly a decade.

episodes.title: BONUS: KILLING TIME: BABERAHAM LINCOLN
episodes.description:
This week the girls and the ginger are here with some fascinating facial hair facts. One in particular actually. The story of Abraham Lincoln’s iconic beard! It’s four score and seven shaves ago, and the story is certainly one you won’t expect. On the stand this week: voice notes, folded potato chips, mayo on fries, and stinkin’ it up at the gym. PLUS! A New Years kiss of death!

episodes.rawTitle: soak blood porn mitchel famili murder
episodes.title: Soaked in Blood and Porn: The Mitchell Family Murders
episodes.description:
Brothers Jim and Artie Mitchell, founders of San Francisco's notorious O'Farrell [porn] Theater were legends; well, they were infamous anyway. The Mitchells were pioneers of modern pornography, producing Behind the Green Door with Marilyn Chambers in 1972. They spent $60,000 to make the movie and it grosed $25,000,000. The Mitchell Brothers partied with rock stars and hung out with Hunter S. Thompson. Then, in 1991, Jim shot Artie and killed him, and Jim would not be the last generation of Mitchell to murder...
Sources:
https://www.mercurynews.com/2007/07/15/porn-king-jim-mitchell-dead-at-63/
http://sfappeal.com/2011/08/heir-to-sf-porn-empire-blames-family-name-for-murder-conviction-35-year-sentence/
https://www.marinij.com/2009/07/13/james-mitchell-jr-had-a-tragic-childhood/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitchell_brothers#Personal_lives

episodes.title: The Ballad of William Fyfe / WKT #26
episodes.minimalTitle: The Ballad of William Fyfe / WKT
episodes.description:
Originally published June 2 2017
On October 29, 1999 Monique Gaudreau, a 45-year-old nurse at a hospital in the Laurentians was found dead at her home in Sainte-Agathe-des-Monts, Quebec. Gaudreau was found in her bedroom. She was beaten, sexually assaulted, and stabbed 55 times.
This is the story of William Patrick Fyfe.
We examine why the serial killer William Fyfe probably wasn't responsible for the Who Killed Theresa? murders.
For more information please visit our website: http://theresaallore.com/2017/06/the-ballad-of-william-fyfe-wkt-26/

episodes.title: 76. [Tennessee] Deborah Groseclose
episodes.description:
We are going to Tennessee this week where we cover the tragic murder of a young mother named Deborah Groseclose.

Tennessee Fun Fact: Cotton Candy was invented in Tennessee by a dentist and a candy maker. It was debuted at the 1904 St. Louis Fair where they sold thousands!

Find us on the webs!

episodes.rawTitle: introduc spine chiller serial killer carl tanzler murder cindi jame
episodes.title: Introducing: Spine Chillers and Serial Killers - Carl Tanzler and the "Murder?" of Cindy James
episodes.description:
This week, I want to introduce you to Spine Chillers and Serial Killers.
Emma tells the story or George Karl Tanzler aka Karl Tanzler aka Carl Tanzler aka Count von Cosel. (Yeah, this guy is weird.) Find out how a visit from a spirit in his childhood molded him into, well, a very strange guy, and what he did to the love of his life Elena.
Becky follows up with an equally weird story about Cindy James and how she died. Let us know your thoughts on this case, as we found it fascinating.
As always served with a good portion of laughter and banter.
We really hope you like this episode and if you did please leave us a rating or review. Don't forget to follow us or subscribe so you never miss a new episode.
You can find us on Facebook at Spine Chillers and Serial Killers or on Tiktok, Twitter and Instagram at @SCSK_podcast. You can also email us with any feedback, cases you'd like us to cover, your own personal paranormal stories, or true crime cases at chillers.killers.pod@gmail.com.

episodes.title: REOPENED: The Night Shift
episodes.description:
A college student in Utah is brutally murdered while working the graveyard shift at a local gas station. His death shakes this small Mormon community to its core, but all police have to go on are some bloody dollar bills, and two eye-witnesses who sketch out a figure, with dark, piercing eyes. Who could have committed this horrific crime? Was it a disgruntled employee? Is there a connection to an illegal drug ring? And will advances in forensic technology decades later help to bring Brad Perry's killer to justice?

Check out our great sponsors!

episodes.title: 🔒 When Thoughts Create Monsters
episodes.description:
Subscriber-only episode

Wouldn't it be wild if it were possible for humans to create monsters just from their thoughts. Well some say this is true. And there have been some terrifying stories about these types of experiments gone wrong. Learn about this monstrous legends in today's special episode for our beloved premium subscribers.

episodes.title: #152 - Adnan Syed: a morte de Hae | Parte 1
episodes.minimalTitle: Adnan Syed: a morte de Hae | Parte 1
episodes.description: Apoie o Modus: https://orelo.cc/modusoperandi/apoios - 📕 Modus Operandi: Guia de true crime na sua livraria favorita ou on-line. - Em janeiro de 1999, a adolescente Hae Min Lee desapareceu em Baltimore, nos Estados Unidos, e seu corpo foi encontrado em um parque após seis semanas. Depois de uma investigação não muito longa, o ex-namorado dela, Adnan Syed, foi considerado pela polícia o principal suspeito desse homicídio. Em 2014, o podcast Serial contou essa história de uma forma totalmente diferente da polícia.

episodes.rawTitle: killer psych daili campus crisi mass shoot msu
episodes.title: Killer Psyche Daily: Campus in Crisis: The Mass  Shooting at MSU
episodes.description:
On Monday, students at Michigan State University spent hours in hiding as an active shooter terrorized their campus. Three students were killed in the shooting, and five others were critically injured. Candice and her producer Julie Berke discuss the tragic events that unfolded and the criminal history of the now-deceased suspect.

SAMHSA National Disaster Distress Hotline:

1-800-985-5990

episodes.rawTitle: cieha taylor taniyah leonard calvin johnni hunt
episodes.title: 366 // Cieha Taylor, Ta'Niyah Leonard, Calvin Johnny Hunt
episodes.description:
In this episode Crawlspace Media's Tim Pilleri, Lance Reenstierna and Jennifer Amell speak with Katrina Overstreet and Brian Hunt about the disappearances of their siblings (Cieha Taylor and Calvin Johnny Hunt) and Katrina's cousin Ta'Niyah Leonard.

Cieha Taylor went missing on February 6th, 2020 from Plant City, Florida under suspicious circumstances. Cieha's sister Katrina is searching for answers in her sister's case. Katrina and Cieha's cousin Ta'Niyah Leonard went missing on October 19th, 2002 from Bartow, Florida. Ta'Niyah was 11 months old at the time. Calvin Johnny Hunt went missing on May 29th, 2018 from Ten Mile, Tennessee. Brian is searching for answers for his brother Johnny's case.

GoFundMe: https://www.gofundme.com/f/to-get-a-new-sign

Follow their FB page: https://www.facebook.com/findingcieha/

Please donate to the family GoFundMe if you can: https://www.gofundme.com/f/ma2tz3-justice-for-johnny

The family Fb page: https://www.facebook.com/calvinjohnhunt

Check out our Missing subscription service where we have a bonus show and ad-free episodes! https://missing.supportingcast.fm/

For more information on Morgan & Morgan go to https://www.ForThePeople.com/MISSING.

Sources:

https://charleyproject.org/case/taniyah-monique-leonard

https://www.wtsp.com/article/news/special-reports/the-missing/taniyah-leonard-the-missing/67-2e6741d9-33e5-4a54-a680-fecbb16d39db

https://www.oxygen.com/crime-news/cieha-taylor-missing-family-searches-after-car-found-on-florida-tracks

episodes.title: #334 Jason Flom with Anthony Sims - UPDATE
episodes.minimalTitle: Jason Flom with Anthony Sims - UPDATE
episodes.description:
This is an updated episode that originally aired on September 21, 2021.

On May 18th, 1998, Charlie Winbush told her fiancé, Julius Graves, that a man named Li Run Chen, who worked at a Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood had touched her inappropriately. Graves replied that he would scare him. Later that day, Julius Graves, his fiancée's cousin, and another younger friend had a few drinks with Graves and his friend Anthony Sims as they listened to music by Sims’ car.

That same evening, Graves asked Sims to drive him to the restaurant where Chen worked and Sims agreed, unaware of any issue with Chen. They went into the restaurant when it is believed that Graves shot and killed Chen. In shock, Sims fled alone while Graves and the two younger men returned to his apartment, wiped the gun clean, figured out where to stash it, and began to conjure up a story to deflect blame from Graves and onto Sims. Consequently, investigators set their sights on Sims who was eventually sentenced to 25 years to life for the crime.

Learn more and get involved at:

https://www.freeanthonysims.com/

https://www.wrongfulconvictionpodcast.com/with-jason-flom

Wrongful Conviction with Jason Flom is a production of Lava for Good™ Podcasts in association with Signal Co No1.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

episodes.rawTitle: charter flight carri brazilian footbal squad disappear mountain outsid medellin
episodes.title: Charter Flight Carrying Brazilian Football Squad Disappear in the Mountains Outside Medellín
episodes.description:
Gustavo Sorola and Chris Demarais uncover the details of LaMia Flight 2933 carrying a Brazilian soccer team and their entourage from Santa Cruz, Bolivia to the final match of the 2016 Copa Sudamericana tournament in Colombia. The flight would disappear in the mountains outside of Medellín after a fuel emergency and resulting engine flame out. What happened to LaMia Flight 2933? How did a low fuel situation get out of hand so quickly? Find out on this episode of Black Box Down.

Find us on social media and buy our merch here! https://linktr.ee/BlackBoxDownPod Go to blackboxdownpod.com to support us directly!

This episode brought to you by Lectric Bikes, go to http://lectricebikes.com to find adventure with Lectric eBikes.

Already a FIRST Member and need your Private RSS feed for this show? Go here: http://bit.ly/FIRSTRSS.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

episodes.title: ROUGHHOUSING: Trailer
episodes.description:
Roughhousing is a new narrative series examining hazing culture in high school sports today. Host Iggy Monda takes listeners inside locker rooms to hear deeply personal stories from kids who have been hazed, parents who have fought for accountability, people who have hazed others, and coaches who are afraid of what their players might do when they’re not looking. Ultimately, he asks why hazing is so ingrained in American culture and what it says about us.

From Religion of Sports and PRX, Rough Housing launches February 23.
